intro: Pimpinella nana, commonly known as dwarf cow parsley, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or moist meadows. Pimpinella nana is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like carrots and parsley.
